SOUTH DAKOTA STATE UNIVERSITY BROOKINGS, SOUTH DAKOTA 57006 College of Arts and Science
ENGLISH DEPARTMENT
div1.p: I was very pleased to receive your letter of September 26, as I had followed with interest Dexter Martin's correspondence with you and had listened to his praise of Black Elk Speaks, which I am ashamed to say I have not read yet but will shortly.

You ask about the details of our program, and I can't give these to you because they haven't been worked out. Our theme will be "The Last Frontier," and we plan a four-weeks' summer program of lectures, dramatic and music productions, and other presentations that will fit into the theme. We are hoping that we will be able to find individuals whose knowledge of the frontier will enable them to lecture to a group of South Dakotans on the history and literature of the frontier period. It will not be necessary, of course, that a person be here for the entire four weeks. If you are interested and have the time and energy, perhaps you could come for a one week stay or even for one lecture or talk, or whatever you would want to call it.
When we have made more definite plans for the program I will write to you. I hope you will be interested in coming and that we can look forward to seeing you.

closer.note: Jack W. Marken, Head, Dept. of English
